h1:title: Hello There ğŸ‘‹ Welcome to Mesih's JSON Website Generator ğŸš€
md:info:
Once upon a time, there was a PhD student named Mesih ğŸ¤“. He was knee-deep in research, studying the intricacies of bioinformatics ğŸ§¬. But as he worked on his manuscript, he found himself facing a common problem among researchers: creating companion websites to showcase his findings.

Mesih found himself creating three separate websites for three different manuscripts, and each time he thought to himself, "there has to be a better way!" ğŸ¤”

So, being the tech-savvy bioinformatician that he is, Mesih set out to create a website generator that would make it easy for researchers like himself to present their findings in a visually appealing and interactive way ğŸš€.

He realized that with JSON, a dictionary-like format, he could represent nearly anything! ğŸ¤¯ So, he got to work and created the generator you see before you today.

With this generator, you can easily create tables, charts, and graphs to present your findings in a clear and easy-to-understand format. You can also include interactive elements, such as charts, that allow visitors to explore the data in more depth. ğŸ“ŠğŸ“ˆğŸ”

Not only that, but you can also use the generator to create pages that provide explanations of key concepts and techniques used in your research. For example, you could include markdown sections with explanations and diagrams to help visitors understand the methods and techniques used in your study.ğŸ”¬ğŸ“

But that's not all! The generator can also be used for creating portfolios, landing pages, documentation websites, event websites and more. ğŸš€ğŸ“ŠğŸ’»

And so, with the help of a little bit of coding magic ğŸ§™â€â™‚ï¸ and a lot of determination, Mesih created a website generator that makes it easy for researchers to present their findings in an interactive and easily accessible format.

Here you are using it, Mesih's creation, a website generator that will make your research presentation a breeze ğŸŒ¬ğŸŒª.

This generator allows you to create visually stunning websites with just a simple JSON file. ğŸ’»ğŸ“œ In this documentation, you'll learn how to become a website creating pro and add all sorts of fancy elements to your site.ğŸ“šğŸ”¥

##### Loading JSON ğŸ“

ğŸš€ Are you ready to take your website game to the next level? ğŸ¤” But first things first, let's learn how to load that juicy JSON data onto the site! ğŸ¤— Whether you prefer the classic "browse your computer" method or the fancy "URL magic" trick, we've got you covered. ğŸ§™â€â™‚ï¸

So, you've got two options, my friend! ğŸ¤”

Option 2: You can be a real tech-savvy ğŸ¤– and use the `?json=` argument in this website URL. This way, you can load a JSON file straight from the internet, like from Github. ğŸŒ Just make sure the file is publicly accessible, otherwise it's gonna be a no-go. ğŸš«

navpage:about.h2:title: What is all about this page?
navpage:about.md:info:
This site creates beautiful and interactive static websites from json ğŸ’»ğŸš€ Here are a few ways you can use this website generator to showcase your skills and ideas:

1.  **Creating a portfolio website:** Show off your past projects and skills with a sleek and professional website ğŸ’¼
    
2.  **Building a landing page:** Use the generator to create a landing page for a specific product or service you're offering. You can include product information, and  contact information ğŸ›
    
3.  **Building a documentation website:** Create a website to document a project, software, or any product. You can include installation instructions, usage examples, and API references ğŸ“š
    
4.  **Building an event website:** Create a website for an upcoming event, such as a conference, concert, or festival. You can include event information, and a schedule ğŸ«.

But the generator isn't limited to just these uses. It's also perfect for bioinformatics research ğŸ§¬. You can use the generator to create a website as a supplement to your research paper. It's perfect for presenting findings, data, and other information in a visually appealing and interactive way.

5.  **Research Paper Companion Website** You can use the generator to create a webpage that includes tables, charts, and graphs to present your findings in a clear and easy-to-understand format. You can also include interactive elements such as buttons, that allow visitors to explore the data in more depth.

You can also use the `section` tag to help organize elements and create custom layouts. This is useful for creating pages that provide explanations of key concepts and techniques used in your research. You can include markdown sections with explanations and diagrams to help visitors understand the methods and techniques used in your study.

Additionally, you could also use the `table` tag to create tables that are paginated, searchable, and filterable. This can be useful for creating a "Methods" page where you can provide detailed information about the participants, materials, procedures, and data analysis methods used in your study.

You could also use the `navpage` tag to create a page that is shown in the AppBar ğŸª„ and create a "References" page where you can list all the sources used in your research paper.

Overall, using a website generator to create a supplement to your research paper can be an effective way to present your findings, data, and explanations in an interactive and easily accessible format.ğŸ“ŠğŸ“ˆğŸ”

navpage:layouts.h2:title: ğŸ“– Layouts
navpage:layouts.md:layout:
You can create different layout options available using the xs property. The keys ğŸ”‘ in the JSON file represent the type ğŸ“ of element and the width ğŸ“ of the grid (using the xs property) in the website generator's grid system ğŸ› . They're separated by colons ğŸ”. For example, `md:info:6` creates a markdown section named info and takes up half of the page ğŸŒŸ.

#####ğŸ”¥ Two Column Layout

To create a two-column layout, you'll need to specify the xs property for each element. The xs property determines the width of the element on the page, with a maximum value of 12.
navpage:layouts.md:layoutexp:6:
Here's an example of a two-column layout:

```json
{
    "h2:title": "Here is how a 2-column layout looks like!",
    "md:column1:6": "ğŸ“ This is the content for column 1",
    "md:column2:6": "ğŸ“ This is the content for column 2"
}
```

In this example, both `column1` and `column2` have an xs value of 6, which means they will each take up half of the available space on the page.

section:ex4:6.h2:title: Here is how a 2-column layout looks like!
section:ex4:6.md:column1:6: ğŸ“ This is the content for column 1
section:ex4:6.md:column2:6: ğŸ“ This is the content for column 2

navpage:layouts.md:tips:
##### ğŸ’¡ Tips

- To create a three-column layout, you'll need to set the xs property for each element to a value of 4.
- You can also use the xs property to create a single-column layout by setting the xs property for all elements to a value of 12 or not specifying them at all!
- ğŸ¨ Remember to have fun and be creative with your layouts!
***

navpage:bioinformatics.h2:title: JSON Website Generator for Bioinformatics Research ğŸŒŸ
navpage:bioinformatics.md:intro:
Are you a bioinformatics researcher looking to present your findings in a visually appealing and interactive way? Look no further! Our generator is designed to make it easy for you to create a beautiful and professional-looking website ğŸ’» to showcase your research ğŸ”¬.

With our generator, you can easily display important information such as protein sequences ğŸ§¬ using the `seq` tag, protein structures ğŸ”¬ using the `pdb` tag, and charts ğŸ“ˆ using the `plot` tag. Plus, with the `navpage` tag ğŸ”–, you can create pages that will be displayed in the AppBar ğŸ“±, making it easy for visitors to navigate your site.

Moreover, creating tables to present your data can be a tedious task, but not with our generator! With the `table` tag ğŸ“Š, you can easily generate tables to showcase your data in a  clear and organized way. You can customize the columns ğŸ”³, set the rowsğŸ”², and even add links to other pages within your site for additional information. Plus, you can use the `l:` prefix to create a column with a hyperlink, making it easy for visitors to access more information. And the best part? Our tables are not only beautiful ğŸ’…, but also fully interactive  ğŸ¤–. You can easily paginate ğŸ“„, search ğŸ”, and filter ğŸ•µï¸â€â™‚ï¸ your data, making it easy for visitors to find the information they need. With our generator, creating tables to present your data is now a breeze ğŸ’¨.

So why wait? Give our generator a try and take your research presentation to the next level ğŸš€.
navpage:bioinformatics.md:ex1:6:
##### An Example: Understanding the Spike Protein of COVID-19 ğŸ¦ 

One of the key proteins in the COVID-19 virus is the spike protein. It plays a crucial role in the virus's ability to enter host cells. 

But what does the spike protein look like? With our generator's `seq` tag ğŸ”, we can easily display the protein sequence ğŸ§¬ in a clear and easy to read format.

But just seeing the sequence isn't enough. To truly understand the spike protein, we need to visualize its structure ğŸ”¬. With the `pdb` tag, we can easily embed 3D structures of the spike protein.

For example, here is the spike protein of COVID-19 with the structure path of "rcsb://6vsb":

```json
{
	"h2:title":"Covid Spike Protein Sequence & Structure",
    "seq:spike_protein": "MFVFLVLLPLVSSQCVNLTTRTQLPPAYTNSFTRGVYYPDKVFRSSVLHSTQDLFLPFFSNVTWFHAIHVSGTNGTKRFDNPVLPFNDGVYFASTEKSNIIRGWIFGTTLDSKTQSLLIV",
    "pdb:spike_structure": {
        "path":"rcsb://6VSB Spike Protein",
        "name":"6vsb",
        "height":"400px"
    }
}
```
With this generator, you can easily showcase the protein sequence and structure of the spike protein, providing visitors with a deeper understanding of the virus ğŸ§
navpage:bioinformatics.md:ex2intro:
##### Tables

ğŸ’»Creating tables with the table tag is a breeze! ğŸ” Just specify the rows and columns as arrays and voila! ğŸ‰Your resulting page will be not only paginated, but also searchable and filterable.ğŸ”ğŸ” Making it super easy to navigate and find the information you need! ğŸ™Œ

rows: Structure and Mechanism of the SARS-CoV-2 Spike Protein
Cryo-EM structure of the SARS-CoV-2 spike receptor-binding domain bound to ACE2
Atomic structure of the SARS-CoV-2 spike glycoprotein
